Message:
With one last warm smile,
the illusion of my mother
vanished.

I’ll keep moving forward
with my comrades at my side.

After bidding my mother
farewell deep within my heart,

I raised my head and focused
on the remaining enemy.

I quickly draw my sword
and tear apart the blockade
of illusions before me,
clearing my path.

I dash full speed ahead...
towards the creature...
piercing through it!

As if bursting like a bubble,
the cursed creature
vanished into the air,
lifting the fog from the area.

The light that now dwells
in my hand is proof of that.

Around me, the children
regained their senses
and began to move.

Hearing those words,
Moddey looked
proud of herself.
“Didja expect anything
less from me?” she said.

“By the way, Moddey.
You don’t seem
bothered being
this deep in the water.
It looks like you’ve
overcome your fear.”

“...Ah... Ahhhhh...!
Just as I thought—
I can’t do water...!
Lailaaa! Saaave meee!!”

To think she can run
around in the lake with
that much energy...

With how quickly
she’s grown,
it looks like she has
much to teach me too.
